In the context of Supply Chain Management, which of the following refers to the coordination of all supply activities of an organization from its suppliers and partners to its customers?
A. Supply Chain Integration
B. Supply Chain Diversification
C. Supply Chain Segmentation
D. Supply Chain Disruption

A. Supply Chain Integration

Supply Chain Integration refers to the coordination of all supply activities of an organization from its suppliers and partners to its customers. This approach emphasizes the alignment and synchronization of various functions and processes across different entities in the supply chain to achieve overall efficiency and effectiveness. By integrating the supply chain, organizations can improve communication, reduce lead times, enhance responsiveness to customer demands, and optimize resource utilization. This holistic view of the supply chain helps in creating a more agile and resilient system capable of adapting to market changes and uncertainties.
